sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Turkey's President Erdogan ordered 20 airstrikes against the Kurdistan Workers' Party, or PKK, in northern Iraq after a suicide bomb attack in Ankara.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Populist former Prime Minister Robert Fico and his leftist Smur party win Slovakia's parliamentary elections after campaigning on a pro-Russia message.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In Poland, hundreds of thousands of opposition supporters marched through Warsaw just two weeks before a crucial parliamentary election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Armenians from across Europe gather in Brussels to demand sanctions against Azerbaijan after it occupied Nagorno-Karabakh.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: After Sunday morning's suicide bomb attack in Ankara, retribution from Turkey was swift, with 20 airstrikes on PKK or Kurdistan Workers' Party targets in northern Iraq.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A group linked to the PKK had said it was behind the bombing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Hours later in Parliament, a tough and distinctly unilateral message from Turkey's president. If they return from their wrongdoings, they will correct their mistakes. The attack in Ankara left two police officers injured and two attackers dead and prompted tight security on the Turkish capital's streets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Populist former Prime Minister Robert Fico and his leftist Smur party have won Slovakia's parliamentary elections in what's widely seen as a victory for Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: After a campaign based on a pro-Russia, anti-American message, Smur led with 22.9 percent, the Slovak statistics office said on Sunday, after counting more than 99.9 percent of the vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: FICO's main rival, Mikhail Simaker, whose progressive Slovakia party was a distant second at 18 percent, said FICO's win is bad news for the country and would be even worse if SMUR manages to form a government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: worse if Smur manages to form a government. The country of 5.5 million people has been a staunch supporter of Ukraine since Russia's invasion last year, donating weapons and opening its borders to refugees fleeing the war. FICO opposes EU sanctions on Russia and wants to block Ukraine from joining NATO. Hundreds of thousands of opposition supporters marched through Warsaw on Sunday,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: just two weeks before a crucial parliamentary election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Opposition leader Donald Tusk, who was once the European Council president, is trying to get rid of the controversial nationalist government that's been eroding the rule of law. After it was found to be limiting the independence of its judges, the EU has been fining Poland half a million euros every day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The ruling Law and Justice Party has also interfered with state media to ensure it mostly promotes the government's views.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And it's promoted populist policies, such as demanding Germany pay reparations for atrocities committed in World War II.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Recent surveys suggest the opposition's electoral alliance is a few percentage points behind law and justice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But Donald Tusk says he thinks the wider opposition could defeat the ruling party and former government, and at the start of the march he greeted leaders of the centrist Third Way Party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Armenians from across Europe gathered in Brussels on Sunday to demand sanctions against Azerbaijan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Almost all of the ethnic Armenians living in Nagorno-Karabakh fled to Armenia after Azerbaijan's forces occupied the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They feared that they wouldn't be treated humanely if they'd remained, and their way of life as Christians who speak their own language would have been threatened.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: On Sunday, a UN mission arrived there to assess the humanitarian needs of those who didn't or couldn't flee.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Armenian fighters who had controlled Nagorno-Karabakh for 30 years surrendered, and Azerbaijan is now in full control of the Lachin Corridor, that used to be the only main road connecting the region to Armenia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Also on Sunday, Azerbaijan's prosecutor general issued an arrest warrant for the former Armenian leader of Nagorno-Karabakh.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Armenian government that was in charge of the region has said it will dissolve itself by the end of the year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Spanish city of Murcia went into three days of mourning on Sunday after at least 13 people died in a nightclub fire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Officials fear the number could rise as several people are still reported missing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The fire started around 6am in the Teatro nightclub and quickly spread through the venue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's not yet clear what caused it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The police and the emergency services tried to prevent the whole building from collapsing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They're still trying to locate the victims' bodies and identify them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09

sentences.sentence: Thousands of residents have struggled to get compensation. Duizenden bewoners hebben gestraagd om compensatie te krijgen. Er is gezegd dat er moet verstevigd worden.

sentences.sentence: De ontdekking van de Kroningen en Kerstveld was heel belangrijk voor het Nederlandse economie, omdat het ons toegelichtte om een aantal rekeningen van ongeveer 15 biljoen euro's te maken.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09

sentences.sentence: A parliamentary inquiry earlier this year found that the government had placed too much importance on gas extraction.

sentences.sentence: It's important because we know there is a direct link between the earthquakes and gas extraction and luckily we are able to do without the Groningen gas field.

sentences.sentence: This is Fernand van Tetz reporting for Euronews, Groningen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Some countries within the borderless Schengen area are stepping up checks on their frontiers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Yet one of the main principles of the Schengen agreement is freedom of movement of citizens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: There are clauses that provide for the temporary restoration of border controls, primarily when it concerns a threat to public order or internal security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And so far in 2023, at least seven Schengen states have taken advantage of these provisions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: So is the treaty working as hoped?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: What we are seeing now is yet another example of the fragility of the Schengen borderless area and this is for a number of reasons and there are political reasons and have to do with upcoming elections at the local and national level which have put central governments under pressure they also have to do with the additional arrivals especially in southern European countries, and the possibility of further secondary movements to northern European countries that have seen an uptake in first-time asylum applications in recent months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: JANET NAPOLITANO, The Wall Street Journal, The Wall Street Journal Germany calls the resumption of border checks with Poland and the Czech Republic one of the options for combating human traffickers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: checks with Poland and the Czech Republic one of the options for combating human traffickers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Slovenia is also stepping up surveillance of its border crossing with Croatia, which recently joined the Schengen area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It is often just a matter of spot checks. They check some of the people that cross, but it is not really a full reintroduction of internal borders as such. It is a symbolic measure for the domestic public.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And as such, probably it is not as important as some politicians would want it to be.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But the Schengen system on its own is fine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: How old is too old to be a political leader?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's a popular question in the United States, where the current president is is 81 next month and he wants to remain president for another six years. And since life expectancy in the U.S. is just 76, it's not outlandish to question whether Joe Biden could possibly die in office if he wins a second term. U.S. Republican presidential candidate Nikki Haley, who is a mere 44, has called for so-called lucidity tests to be mandatory for politicians over 75.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In Brazil, President Lula is 77, whilst Russia's Vladimir Putin is 70.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Other European leaders are in their much younger 40s.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Usually in the past, prime ministers were used to enter office after accumulating a lot of experience in parliament, in the party, in the cabinet. But now we have more and more outsiders with low political experience, more technical experience, and they are young. So in this case, maybe the issue about age is the effect that can have on what prime ministers do after being in office. More and more, you have these leaders going into the private sector and this may raise issues of accountability.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Many of the world's populations, mainly in Asia and Europe, are ageing and it's usually seen as discriminatory to prevent older people from working. So for now it seems unlikely there'll be a mandatory retirement age for world leaders. And ultimately, in democracies at least, it is up to the voters to decide.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Team Europe produced a stunning performance to regain the Ryder Cup in Rome on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: With the hosts needing four points from the final day's singles matches, Tommy Fleetwood won the 11th game to secure the 44th edition against the US.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Europe dominated the event with strong performances by the likes of Jon Ram, Viktor Euland and Rory McIlroy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Captain Luke Donald's strategic decisions paid off, with Europe establishing an early lead and never looking back, en route to a much-needed win two years after losing heavily its whistling straights.
